title: Awesome List Updates on May 18, 2022
_seo_title: Awesome List Updates on May 18, 2022 - Track Awesome List

items.title: Awesome Computational Biology
items.content_text:
### Databases / Compound

*   [ChEBI](https://www.ebi.ac.uk/chebi/) - Chemical database  focused on small chemical compounds.

### Databases / Protein

*   [PROTEIN DATA BANK](https://www.rcsb.org/) - Database of the 3D shapes of proteins, nucleic acids, and complex assemblies.
items.content_html:
Databases / Compound

  • ChEBI - Chemical database focused on small chemical compounds.

Databases / Protein

  • PROTEIN DATA BANK - Database of the 3D shapes of proteins, nucleic acids, and complex assemblies.

items.title: Awesome Terraform
items.content_text:
### Providers / Hashicorp supported providers

*   [terraform-provider-aws (‚≠ê10k)](https://github.com/hashicorp/terraform-provider-aws) - Provider for Amazon Web Services.
*   [terraform-provider-azurerm (‚≠ê4.8k)](https://github.com/hashicorp/terraform-provider-azurerm) - Provider for Azure.
*   [terraform-provider-google (‚≠ê2.5k)](https://github.com/hashicorp/terraform-provider-google) - Provider for Google Cloud Platform.
*   [terraform-provider-helm (‚≠ê1k)](https://github.com/hashicorp/terraform-provider-helm) - Provider for Helm.
*   [terraform-provider-kubernetes (‚≠ê1.7k)](https://github.com/hashicorp/terraform-provider-kubernetes) - Provider for Kubernetes.
*   [terraform-provider-vsphere (‚≠ê648)](https://github.com/hashicorp/terraform-provider-vsphere) - Provider for VMware vSphere.

### Providers / Vendor supported providers

*   [terraform-provider-alicloud (‚≠ê619)](https://github.com/aliyun/terraform-provider-alicloud) - Provider for Alibaba Cloud.
*   [terraform-provider-atlas (‚≠ê59)](https://github.com/ariga/terraform-provider-atlas) - Provider for [Atlas](https://atlasgo.io/).
*   [terraform-provider-buildkite (‚≠ê57)](https://github.com/buildkite/terraform-provider-buildkite) - Provider for Buildkite.
*   [terraform-provider-datadog (‚≠ê422)](https://github.com/DataDog/terraform-provider-datadog) - Provider for Datadog.
*   [terraform-provider-digitalocean (‚≠ê538)](https://github.com/digitalocean/terraform-provider-digitalocean) - Provider for DigitalOcean.
*   [terraform-provider-github](https://github.com/integrations/terraform-provider-github) - Provider for GitHub.
*   [terraform-provider-gitlab (‚≠ê407)](https://github.com/gitlabhq/terraform-provider-gitlab) - Provider for GitLab.
*   [terraform-provider-graphql (‚≠ê56)](https://github.com/sullivtr/terraform-provider-graphql) - Provider for GraphQL queries and mutations.
*   [terraform-provider-hcloud (‚≠ê597)](https://github.com/hetznercloud/terraform-provider-hcloud) - Provider for Hetzner Cloud.
*   [terraform-provider-heroku (‚≠ê101)](https://github.com/heroku/terraform-provider-heroku) - Provider for Heroku.
*   [terraform-provider-ibm (‚≠ê348)](https://github.com/IBM-Cloud/terraform-provider-ibm) - Provider for IBM Cloud.
*   [terraform-provider-linode (‚≠ê72)](https://github.com/btobolaski/terraform-provider-linode) - Provider for Linode.
*   [terraform-provider-spinnaker (‚≠ê143)](https://github.com/armory-io/terraform-provider-spinnaker) - Provider for [Spinnaker](https://www.spinnaker.io/).
*   [terraform-provider-spotinst (‚≠ê64)](https://github.com/spotinst/terraform-provider-spotinst) - Provider for spotinst.
items.content_html:

items.title: Awesome Executable Packing
items.content_text:
### :books: Literature / Documentation

*   :clipboard: [Hyperion: Implementation of a PE-Crypter](https://www.exploit-db.com/docs/english/18849-hyperion-implementation-of-a-pe-crypter.pdf)
*   :pushpin: [Packer detection tool evaluation (‚≠ê13)](https://github.com/FFRI/PackerDetectionToolEvaluation)

### :bookmark_tabs: Datasets / Scientific Research

*   [FFRI Dataset Scripts (‚≠ê12)](https://github.com/FFRI/ffridataset-scripts) - Make datasets like FFRI Dataset.
*   [RCE Lab (‚≠ê42)](https://github.com/apuromafo/RCE_Lab) - Crackme's, keygenme's, serialme's ; the "tuts4you" folder contains many packed binaries.

### :package: Packers / Before 2000

*   [Morphine (‚≠ê296)](https://github.com/bowlofstew/rootkit.com/blob/master/hf/Morphine27) - Application for PE files encryption.
items.content_html:
üìö Literature / Documentation

  • üìã Hyperion: Implementation of a PE-Crypter
  • üìå Packer detection tool evaluation (‚≠ê13)

üìë Datasets / Scientific Research

  • FFRI Dataset Scripts (‚≠ê12) - Make datasets like FFRI Dataset.
  • RCE Lab (‚≠ê42) - Crackme's, keygenme's, serialme's ; the "tuts4you" folder contains many packed binaries.

üì¶ Packers / Before 2000

  • Morphine (‚≠ê296) - Application for PE files encryption.

items.title: Awesome Ada
items.content_text:
### Format Readers, Writers and Checkers / Apache License

*   [uri-ada](https://git.sr.ht/~nytpu/uri-ada) - URI and MIME parser & manipulation library.

### Networking and Communication Middleware / Apache License

*   [tlsada](https://git.sr.ht/~nytpu/tlsada) - Bindings to the libtls TLS/SSL library.

### Utilities / Apache License

*   [getopt-ada](https://git.sr.ht/~nytpu/getopt-ada) - Portable implementation of getopt(3) in Ada.
items.content_html:
Format Readers, Writers and Checkers / Apache License

  • uri-ada - URI and MIME parser & manipulation library.

Networking and Communication Middleware / Apache License

  • tlsada - Bindings to the libtls TLS/SSL library.

Utilities / Apache License

  • getopt-ada - Portable implementation of getopt(3) in Ada.

items.title: Awesome Zsh Plugins
items.content_text:
### Themes / [superconsole](https://github.com/alexchmykhalo/superconsole) - Windows-only

*   [promptor (‚≠ê1)](https://github.com/MickaelBlet/Promptor) - Powerline-inspired. Includes decorators for `git` status, username, hostname, working directory and time.
items.content_html:
Themes / superconsole - Windows-only

  • promptor (‚≠ê1) - Powerline-inspired. Includes decorators for git status, username, hostname, working directory and time.

items.title: Awesome Machine Learning
items.content_text:
### C++ / General-Purpose Machine Learning

*   [N2D2 (‚≠ê155)](https://github.com/CEA-LIST/N2D2) - CEA-List's CAD framework for designing and simulating Deep Neural Network, and building full DNN-based applications on embedded platforms
items.content_html:
C++ / General-Purpose Machine Learning

  • N2D2 (‚≠ê155) - CEA-List's CAD framework for designing and simulating Deep Neural Network, and building full DNN-based applications on embedded platforms

items.title: Awesome Plone
items.content_text:
### Content and utilities for content

*   [collective.a11ycheck (‚≠ê0)](https://github.com/collective/collective.a11ycheck) - Reports accessibility issues to your site editors when a page is saved.
*   [collective.bbcodesnippets (‚≠ê1)](https://github.com/collective/collective.bbcodesnippets) - Provides generic and extensible BBCode markup integration for Plone.
*   [collective.consent (‚≠ê1)](https://github.com/collective/collective.consent) - Ask users for consent to different topics, before they can continue.
*   [collective.dexteritytextindexer (‚≠ê9)](https://github.com/collective/collective.dexteritytextindexer) - Dynamic SearchableText index for dexterity content types. For Plone 6 this was merged into Plone core.
*   [collective.documentviewer (‚≠ê21)](https://github.com/collective/collective.documentviewer) - Very nice document viewer that integrates DocumentCloud viewer and PDF processing into Plone.
*   [collective.easyformplugin.createdx (‚≠ê6)](https://github.com/collective/collective.easyformplugin.createdx) - Creates Plone content objects from EasyForm submissions.
*   [collective.geolocationbehavior (‚≠ê2)](https://github.com/collective/collective.geolocationbehavior) - Geotagging for Plone content using LeafletJS.
*   [collective.glossary (‚≠ê4)](https://github.com/collective/collective.glossary) - Content type to define a glossary and its terms.
*   [collective.immediatecreate (‚≠ê0)](https://github.com/collective/collective.immediatecreate) - Create content immediatly and skip the add form.
*   [collective.lineage (‚≠ê12)](https://github.com/collective/collective.lineage) - Subsites: Turns subfolders of a Plone site to appear as autonomous Plone sites. There is also a whole ecosystem off addons specific to subsites.
*   [collective.mailchimp (‚≠ê5)](https://github.com/collective/collective.mailchimp) - MailChimp newsletter integration for Plone.
*   [collective.mirror (‚≠ê1)](https://github.com/collective/collective.mirror) - A content type that mirrors the content of any other container.
*   [collective.mustread (‚≠ê0)](https://github.com/collective/collective.mustread) - Tracking user views on content that are marked as must-read.
*   [collective.remoteproxy (‚≠ê1)](https://github.com/collective/collective.remoteproxy) - Proxy for remote content. All remote URLs for which a local proxy was created are replaced in the resulting content.
*   [collective.richdescription (‚≠ê1)](https://github.com/collective/collective.richdescription) - Formatable description field for Plone.
*   [collective.workspace (‚≠ê7)](https://github.com/collective/collective.workspace) - Easily manage 'membership' in specific areas of a Plone Site. It allows to grant people access to areas of content using a membership group rather than local roles for each user, and to delegate control over that group to people who don't have access to the site-wide user/group control panel.
*   [plone.pdfexport (‚≠ê3)](https://github.com/plone/plone.pdfexport) - Generic PDF export functionality for Plone content.
*   [Products.EasyNewsletter (‚≠ê29)](https://github.com/collective/Products.EasyNewsletter) - Powerful newsletter/mailing product for Plone.

### Searching and Categorizing

*   [cioppino.twothumbs (‚≠ê14)](https://github.com/collective/cioppino.twothumbs) - Rate content using up- and down-thumbs.
*   [collective.bookmarks (‚≠ê2)](https://github.com/collective/collective.bookmarks) - Bookmarks/ favorites/ wish-list for Plone.
*   [collective.collectionfilter (‚≠ê9)](https://github.com/collective/collective.collectionfilter) - Faceted navigation filter for collection or contentlisting tiles.
*   [collective.elastic.plone (‚≠ê3)](https://github.com/collective/collective.elastic.plone) - ElasticSearch Integration for Plone content.
*   [collective.searchandreplace (‚≠ê6)](https://github.com/collective/collective.searchandreplace) - Find and replace text in Plone content objects.
*   [collective.solr (‚≠ê22)](https://github.com/collective/collective.solr) - Solr search engine integration for Plone.
*   [collective.taxonomy (‚≠ê18)](https://github.com/collective/collective.taxonomy) - Create, edit and use hierarchical taxonomies to categorize content.
*   [eea.facetednavigation (‚≠ê4)](https://github.com/collective/eea.facetednavigation) - Very powerful interface to improve search without programming skills. Configuration is done through-the-web and lets you gradually select and explore different facets (metadata/properties) of the content and narrow down you search quickly and dynamically.
*   [Products.PloneKeywordManager (‚≠ê4)](https://github.com/collective/Products.PloneKeywordManager) - Change, merge and delete keywords/tags/subjects).

### Media

*   [plone.app.imagecropping (‚≠ê9)](https://github.com/collective/plone.app.imagecropping) - Crops Images in Plone manually using cropper JS library.
*   [plone.gallery (‚≠ê5)](https://github.com/plone/plone.gallery) - Photo gallery view for Plone.

### Authentication

*   [pas.plugins.ldap (‚≠ê13)](https://github.com/collective/pas.plugins.ldap) - Provides users and groups from a LDAP directory.

### Shop

*   [bda.plone.productshop (‚≠ê7)](https://github.com/bluedynamics/bda.plone.productshop) - Flexible and modular e-commerce solution for Plone.

### Develop

*   [Products.PDBDebugMode (‚≠ê2)](https://github.com/collective/Products.PDBDebugMode) - Post-mortem debugging: open a pdb session whenever an exception occurs so you you can find out what is going wrong. Plus: By adding /pdb to a url you end up you in a pdb session on the current context. A killer tool for developers.
*   [plone.reload (‚≠ê11)](https://github.com/plone/plone.reload) - Code and configuration reload without server restarts.
*   [Products.PrintingMailHost (‚≠ê2)](https://github.com/collective/Products.PrintingMailHost) - Log mail messages instead of sending mail.
*   [experimental.gracefulblobmissing (‚≠ê2)](https://github.com/collective/experimental.gracefulblobmissing/) - Gracefully handle missing binary files in Plone.
*   [collective.relationhelpers (‚≠ê7)](https://github.com/collective/collective.relationhelpers) - Helpers to manage, create, export and rebuild relations in Plone 5.x. For Plone 6 this was merged into Plone core.

### Sysadmin

*   [collective.fingerpointing (‚≠ê5)](https://github.com/collective/collective.fingerpointing) - Keeps track of different events and write them down to an audit log.
*   [collective.recipe.backup (‚≠ê5)](https://github.com/collective/collective.recipe.backup) - Powerful and flexible backup/restore solution for Plone.
*   [collective.revisionmanager (‚≠ê6)](https://github.com/collective/collective.revisionmanager) - Manage Products.CMFEditions histories that can bloat your database.
*   [collective.sentry (‚≠ê7)](https://github.com/collective/collective.sentry) - Sentry integration to aggregate errors and help finding their causes.
*   [haufe.requestmonitoring (‚≠ê5)](https://github.com/collective/haufe.requestmonitoring) - Detailed request logging functionality on top of the publication events. Useful to find out what takes longer than it should.

### Official resources

*   [Discord chat](https://discord.gg/zFY3EBbjaj) - Discord is the best way to chat with members of the Plone community.
*   [Plone support](https://plone.org/support) - Where to find help.
items.content_html:
Content and utilities for content

  • collective.a11ycheck (‚≠ê0) - Reports accessibility issues to your site editors when a page is saved.
  • collective.bbcodesnippets (‚≠ê1) - Provides generic and extensible BBCode markup integration for Plone.
  • collective.consent (‚≠ê1) - Ask users for consent to different topics, before they can continue.
  • collective.dexteritytextindexer (‚≠ê9) - Dynamic SearchableText index for dexterity content types. For Plone 6 this was merged into Plone core.
  • collective.documentviewer (‚≠ê21) - Very nice document viewer that integrates DocumentCloud viewer and PDF processing into Plone.
  • collective.easyformplugin.createdx (‚≠ê6) - Creates Plone content objects from EasyForm submissions.
  • collective.geolocationbehavior (‚≠ê2) - Geotagging for Plone content using LeafletJS.
  • collective.glossary (‚≠ê4) - Content type to define a glossary and its terms.
  • collective.immediatecreate (‚≠ê0) - Create content immediatly and skip the add form.
  • collective.lineage (‚≠ê12) - Subsites: Turns subfolders of a Plone site to appear as autonomous Plone sites. There is also a whole ecosystem off addons specific to subsites.
  • collective.mailchimp (‚≠ê5) - MailChimp newsletter integration for Plone.
  • collective.mirror (‚≠ê1) - A content type that mirrors the content of any other container.
  • collective.mustread (‚≠ê0) - Tracking user views on content that are marked as must-read.
  • collective.remoteproxy (‚≠ê1) - Proxy for remote content. All remote URLs for which a local proxy was created are replaced in the resulting content.
  • collective.richdescription (‚≠ê1) - Formatable description field for Plone.
  • collective.workspace (‚≠ê7) - Easily manage 'membership' in specific areas of a Plone Site. It allows to grant people access to areas of content using a membership group rather than local roles for each user, and to delegate control over that group to people who don't have access to the site-wide user/group control panel.
  • plone.pdfexport (‚≠ê3) - Generic PDF export functionality for Plone content.
  • Products.EasyNewsletter (‚≠ê29) - Powerful newsletter/mailing product for Plone.

Searching and Categorizing

  • cioppino.twothumbs (‚≠ê14) - Rate content using up- and down-thumbs.
  • collective.bookmarks (‚≠ê2) - Bookmarks/ favorites/ wish-list for Plone.
  • collective.collectionfilter (‚≠ê9) - Faceted navigation filter for collection or contentlisting tiles.
  • collective.elastic.plone (‚≠ê3) - ElasticSearch Integration for Plone content.
  • collective.searchandreplace (‚≠ê6) - Find and replace text in Plone content objects.
  • collective.solr (‚≠ê22) - Solr search engine integration for Plone.
  • collective.taxonomy (‚≠ê18) - Create, edit and use hierarchical taxonomies to categorize content.
  • eea.facetednavigation (‚≠ê4) - Very powerful interface to improve search without programming skills. Configuration is done through-the-web and lets you gradually select and explore different facets (metadata/properties) of the content and narrow down you search quickly and dynamically.
  • Products.PloneKeywordManager (‚≠ê4) - Change, merge and delete keywords/tags/subjects).

Media

  • plone.app.imagecropping (‚≠ê9) - Crops Images in Plone manually using cropper JS library.
  • plone.gallery (‚≠ê5) - Photo gallery view for Plone.

Authentication

  • pas.plugins.ldap (‚≠ê13) - Provides users and groups from a LDAP directory.

Shop

  • bda.plone.productshop (‚≠ê7) - Flexible and modular e-commerce solution for Plone.

Develop

  • Products.PDBDebugMode (‚≠ê2) - Post-mortem debugging: open a pdb session whenever an exception occurs so you you can find out what is going wrong. Plus: By adding /pdb to a url you end up you in a pdb session on the current context. A killer tool for developers.
  • plone.reload (‚≠ê11) - Code and configuration reload without server restarts.
  • Products.PrintingMailHost (‚≠ê2) - Log mail messages instead of sending mail.
  • experimental.gracefulblobmissing (‚≠ê2) - Gracefully handle missing binary files in Plone.
  • collective.relationhelpers (‚≠ê7) - Helpers to manage, create, export and rebuild relations in Plone 5.x. For Plone 6 this was merged into Plone core.

Sysadmin

  • collective.fingerpointing (‚≠ê5) - Keeps track of different events and write them down to an audit log.
  • collective.recipe.backup (‚≠ê5) - Powerful and flexible backup/restore solution for Plone.
  • collective.revisionmanager (‚≠ê6) - Manage Products.CMFEditions histories that can bloat your database.
  • collective.sentry (‚≠ê7) - Sentry integration to aggregate errors and help finding their causes.
  • haufe.requestmonitoring (‚≠ê5) - Detailed request logging functionality on top of the publication events. Useful to find out what takes longer than it should.

Official resources

  • Discord chat - Discord is the best way to chat with members of the Plone community.
  • Plone support - Where to find help.

items.title: Awesome Blazor
items.content_text:
### Videos / Others

*   [ASP.NET Community Standup - Let's build an app with .NET MAUI and Blazor](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7BDBLyADq7s\&list=PLdo4fOcmZ0oX-DBuRG4u58ZTAJgBAeQ-t\&index=2) - ![duration](https://img.shields.io/badge/Duration:%20-92%20min-%230094FF?style=flat-square\&cacheSeconds=maxAge\&logo=youtube) May 17, 2022 - Showcasing migrating a Blazor WASM PWA to .NET MAUI and Blazor Hybrid. [Community links](https://www.theurlist.com/blazor_community_standup_may_2022).
items.content_html:
Videos / Others

  • ASP.NET Community Standup - Let's build an app with .NET MAUI and Blazor - May 17, 2022 - Showcasing migrating a Blazor WASM PWA to .NET MAUI and Blazor Hybrid. Community links.

items.title: Awesome Cl
items.content_text:
### Javascript / Isomorphic web frameworks

*   [sigil (‚≠ê3)](https://github.com/BnMcGn/sigil) - A Parenscript to Javascript command line compiler and REPL. [MIT](https://opensource.org/licenses/MIT).
*   [cl-react (‚≠ê71)](https://github.com/helmutkian/cl-react) -  Common Lisp (Parenscript) utilities for building web apps in ReactJs. MIT.
*   [Panic (‚≠ê43)](https://github.com/michaeljforster/panic), a Parenscript library for React. Not in Quicklisp. [MIT](https://opensource.org/licenses/MIT). Its [TodoMVC example (‚≠ê7)](https://github.com/40ants/todomvc/blob/common-lisp-example/examples/common-lisp-react/src/app.lisp).
*   [Parenscriptx (‚≠ê25)](https://github.com/jasom/parenscriptx) -  Parenscript Macros to aid generating react code. [MIT](https://opensource.org/licenses/MIT).
*   [jscl-react (‚≠ê19)](https://github.com/nilesr/jscl-react) -  A web framework for writing react components in common lisp using jscl. No license specified.
items.content_html:
Javascript / Isomorphic web frameworks

  • sigil (‚≠ê3) - A Parenscript to Javascript command line compiler and REPL. MIT.
  • cl-react (‚≠ê71) - Common Lisp (Parenscript) utilities for building web apps in ReactJs. MIT.
  • Panic (‚≠ê43), a Parenscript library for React. Not in Quicklisp. MIT. Its TodoMVC example (‚≠ê7).
  • Parenscriptx (‚≠ê25) - Parenscript Macros to aid generating react code. MIT.
  • jscl-react (‚≠ê19) - A web framework for writing react components in common lisp using jscl. No license specified.

items.title: Awesome Open Source Games
items.content_text:
### Native / Strategy

*   [Stone Kingdoms](https://gitlab.com/stone-kingdoms/stone-kingdoms) - Real-time strategy based on the original Stronghold series.
items.content_html:
Native / Strategy

  • Stone Kingdoms - Real-time strategy based on the original Stronghold series.
